docs.text:
Class: BusbarSection _A conductor, or group of conductors, with negligible impedance, that serve to connect other conducting equipment within a single substation. _ Voltage measurements are typically obtained from voltage transformers that are connected to busbar sections. A bus bar section may have many physical terminals but for analysis is modelled with exactly one logical terminal. docs.title: Class: BusbarSection

docs.text: _A conductor, or group of conductors, with negligible impedance, that serve to connect other conducting equipment within a single substation. _ Voltage measurements are typically obtained from voltage transformers that are connected to busbar sections. A bus bar section may have many physical terminals but for analysis is modelled with exactly one logical terminal. docs.text:
name : ConductingEquipment description : The parts of the AC power system that are designed to carry current or that are conductively connected through terminals. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/im-e-system-capacity/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 is_a : Equipment attributes : aggregate : name : aggregate description : "The aggregate flag provides an alternative way of representing an\ \ aggregated (equivalent) element. It is applicable in cases when the dedicated\ \ classes for equivalent equipment do not have all of the attributes necessary\ \ to represent the required level of detail. In case the flag is set to “true”\ \ the single instance of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that\ \ have been modelled together as an aggregate equivalent obtained by a network\ \ reduction procedure. Examples would be power transformers or synchronous machines\ \ operating in parallel modelled as a single aggregate power transformer or\ \ aggregate synchronous machine. 
The attribute is not used for EquivalentBranch,\ \ EquivalentShunt and EquivalentInjection." from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/im-e-system-capacity/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:Equipment.aggregate alias : aggregate owner : ConductingEquipment domain_of : - Equipment range : boolean required : false multivalued : false normally_in_service : name : normally_in_service description : Specifies the availability of the equipment under normal operating conditions. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/im-e-system-capacity/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:Equipment.normallyInService alias : normally_in_service owner : ConductingEquipment domain_of : - Equipment range : boolean required : false multivalued : false aliasName : name : aliasName description : "The aliasName is free text human readable name of the object alternative\ \ to IdentifiedObject.name. It is applicable in cases when the dedicated\ \ classes for equivalent equipment do not have all of the attributes necessary\ \ to represent the required level of detail. In case the flag is set to “true”\ \ the single instance of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that\ \ have been modelled together as an aggregate equivalent obtained by a network\ \ reduction procedure. Examples would be power transformers or synchronous machines\ \ operating in parallel modelled as a single aggregate power transformer or\ \ aggregate synchronous machine. 
The attribute is not used for EquivalentBranch,\ \ EquivalentShunt and EquivalentInjection." from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/im-e-system-capacity/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:Equipment.aggregate domain_of : - Equipment range : boolean required : false multivalued : false normally_in_service : name : normally_in_service description : Specifies the availability of the equipment under normal operating conditions. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/im-e-system-capacity/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:Equipment.normallyInService domain_of : - Equipment range : boolean required : false multivalued : false class_uri : cim:Equipment Induced name : Equipment description : The parts of a power system that are physical devices, electronic or mechanical. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/im-e-system-capacity/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 is_a : PowerSystemResource attributes : aggregate : name : aggregate description : "The aggregate flag provides an alternative way of representing an\ \ aggregated (equivalent) element. docs.text: name : Equipment description : The parts of a power system that are physical devices, electronic or mechanical. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/im-e-system-capacity/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 is_a : PowerSystemResource attributes : aggregate : name : aggregate description : "The aggregate flag provides an alternative way of representing an\ \ aggregated (equivalent) element. It is applicable in cases when the dedicated\ \ classes for equivalent equipment do not have all of the attributes necessary\ \ to represent the required level of detail. In case the flag is set to “true”\ \ the single instance of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that\ \ have been modelled together as an aggregate equivalent obtained by a network\ \ reduction procedure. Examples would be power transformers or synchronous machines\ \ operating in parallel modelled as a single aggregate power transformer or\ \ aggregate synchronous machine. \nThe attribute is not used for EquivalentBranch,\ \ EquivalentShunt and EquivalentInjection." from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/im-e-system-capacity/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:Equipment.aggregate domain_of : - Equipment range : boolean required : false multivalued : false normally_in_service : name : normally_in_service description : Specifies the availability of the equipment under normal operating conditions. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/im-e-system-capacity/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:Equipment.normallyInService domain_of : - Equipment range : boolean required : false multivalued : false class_uri : cim:Equipment

In case the flag is set to “true”\ \ the single instance of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that\ \ have been modelled together as an aggregate equivalent obtained by a network\ \ reduction procedure. Examples would be power transformers or synchronous machines\ \ operating in parallel modelled as a single aggregate power transformer or\ \ aggregate synchronous machine. 
The attribute is not used for EquivalentBranch,\ \ EquivalentShunt and EquivalentInjection." from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/im-e-system-capacity/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:Equipment.aggregate alias : aggregate owner : Equipment domain_of : - Equipment range : boolean required : false multivalued : false normally_in_service : name : normally_in_service description : Specifies the availability of the equipment under normal operating conditions. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/im-e-system-capacity/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:Equipment.normallyInService alias : normally_in_service owner : Equipment domain_of : - Equipment range : boolean required : false multivalued : false aliasName : name : aliasName description : "The aliasName is free text human readable name of the object alternative\ \ to IdentifiedObject.name. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a\ \ naming hierarchy.
The attribute aliasName is retained because of backwards\ \ compatibility between CIM relases. It is however recommended to replace aliasName\ \ with the Name class as aliasName is planned for retirement at a future time.\

For details on EAN scheme please refer to the [Codebesluit toekenning EAN-codes elektriciteit](https://www.acm.nl/nl/publicaties/codebesluit-toekenning-ean-codes-elektriciteit). from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/im-e-system-capacity/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : nl:IdentifiedObject.europeanArticleNumberEAN alias : european_article_number_ean owner : Equipment domain_of : - IdentifiedObject range : string required : false multivalued : false m_rid : name : m_rid description : Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. docs.text: A summary of load and generation connection activity over the last year related to a given busbar group. Counts and capacities of proposed connections, aggregated at the busbar group level, are provided for the following activities. Budget estimates provided, connections offered and connection offers accepted. docs.text: Slot: aggregate _The aggregate flag provides an alternative way of representing an aggregated (equivalent) element. It is applicable in cases when the dedicated classes for equivalent equipment do not have all of the attributes necessary to represent the required level of detail. In case the flag is set to “true” the single instance of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that have been modelled together as an aggregate equivalent obtained by a network reduction procedure. Examples would be power transformers or synchronous machines operating in parallel modelled as a single aggregate power transformer or aggregate synchronous machine. _ The attribute is not used for EquivalentBranch, EquivalentShunt and EquivalentInjection. URI: cim:Equipment.aggregate Applicable Classes Name Description Modifies Slot ConductingEquipment The parts of the AC power system that are designed to carry current or that a... no Connector A conductor, or group of conductors, with negligible impedance, that serve to... no BusbarSection A conductor, or group of conductors, with negligible impedance, that serve to... no Equipment The parts of a power system that are physical devices, electronic or mechanic... no Properties Range: Boolean Identifier and Mapping Information Schema Source from schema: http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/im-e-system-capacity/version#1.0.0 Mappings Mapping Type Mapped Value self cim:Equipment.aggregate native this:aggregate LinkML Source name : aggregate description : "The aggregate flag provides an alternative way of representing an aggregated\ \ (equivalent) element. It is applicable in cases when the dedicated classes for\ \ equivalent equipment do not have all of the attributes necessary to represent\ \ the required level of detail. In case the flag is set to “true” the single instance\ \ of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that have been modelled together\ \ as an aggregate equivalent obtained by a network reduction procedure. Examples\ \ would be power transformers or synchronous machines operating in parallel modelled\ \ as a single aggregate power transformer or aggregate synchronous machine. \n\ The attribute is not used for EquivalentBranch, EquivalentShunt and EquivalentInjection." from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/im-e-system-capacity/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:Equipment.aggregate alias : aggregate owner : Equipment domain_of : - Equipment range : boolean required : false multivalued : false

docs.text:
Slot: aliasName _The aliasName is free text human readable name of the object alternative to IdentifiedObject.name. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy. _ _The attribute aliasName is retained because of backwards compatibility between CIM relases. It is however recommended to replace aliasName with the Name class as aliasName is planned for retirement at a future time. _ _ _ __ URI: cim:IdentifiedObject.aliasName Applicable Classes Name Description Modifies Slot PowerSystemResource A power system resource (PSR) can be an item of equipment such as a switch, a... no BusbarSection A conductor, or group of conductors, with negligible impedance, that serve to... no SummaryShortCircuitResult Short circuit result obtained from multiple short circuit calculations using ... no ShortCircuitResult Used to report on result of a short circuit calculation or an outcome of mult... no ConductingEquipment The parts of the AC power system that are designed to carry current or that a... no Connector A conductor, or group of conductors, with negligible impedance, that serve to... no PastYearConnectionActivity A summary of load and generation connection activity over the last year relat... no MaximumLoading Information on maximum busbar section loading during summer and winter period... no FirmCapacity Seasonal busbar section firm capacity information no Equipment The parts of a power system that are physical devices, electronic or mechanic... no IdentifiedObject This is a root class to provide common identification for all classes needing... no Properties Range: String Identifier and Mapping Information Schema Source from schema: http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/im-e-system-capacity/version#1.0.0 Mappings Mapping Type Mapped Value self cim:IdentifiedObject.aliasName native this:aliasName LinkML Source name : aliasName description : "The aliasName is free text human readable name of the object alternative\ \ to IdentifiedObject.name. docs.text: Slot: mRID _Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended. _ For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.\r\ \nFor CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped\ \ to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements." from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/im-e-system-capacity/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:IdentifiedObject.mRID alias : mRID owner : IdentifiedObject domain_of : - IdentifiedObject range : string required : false multivalued : false

docs.text: Slot: m_rid Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended. For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.
